info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 31 at 3:58PM MDT by NWS Pueblo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Prowers, Kiowa and northeastern Bent Counties through 500 PM MDT... At 358 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from 8 miles east of Haswell to near Sheridan Lake to Holly. Movement was north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph, and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Brandon around 410 PM MDT. Sheridan Lake around 415 PM MDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Towner. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
